text: this was one of the first games i got for my ds. the old, fat one, when they first came out. I'd never played anything outside of pokemon on my gameboy so I had no idea what was going on in the game.. and whatever was going on it freaked me out. especially the music, so atmospheric and somber in comparison to the kiddy stuff I usually played. I could probably go back and beat it now... this game got me into rpgs lol without me knowing it. thanks for the upload. i need to go look up gameplay of this :o

text: Matthew NPC I like what ya did there.
author: Jamil Warren

text: 9 minutes of relaxing goodness. I love the choice of instruments. What's sad about it though, is how it plays in a tiny area full of monsters. Not only do you spend a small amount of time there, but each battle interrupts the theme and then it starts all over again. That's always been a major pet peeve of mine in RPGs: field themes should continue playing from the moment they were at before a battle interrupted them. It's pretty much impossible to listen to this whole theme other than outside the game or if you stand and do nothing.
author: SupraDarky

text: This is really relaxing.  I was wondering Gabe, what are your thoughts on Reaper of Souls so far?
